topics.body:
I must sleep now, but before I leave...

They're watching you. All of the time. 

Not because you are particularly special, indeed its your lack of specialness that has drawn them to you.

If only you knew the master they served, if only you knew that just being a little more a part of the lives around you would spare you so many terrible things...

One of them rubs his eyes and takes another drag on the foul, unfiltered cigarette, the same sort he's been smoking since his shift started at eight. He feels sorry for you, but knows that he can't let that sympathy interfere with what has to be done.

At least what he thinks has to be done, the fact that he only has that thing living in the basement twelve blocks away from your home's word bothers him sometimes, but on balance... well...

Its a small price to pay.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
A car had been in an accident.
The driver was my dad's personal driver.
He was driving the university car.

My dad says that there's a chance he might get fired if he is proven guilty for using it for leisure.

I don't want him to get fired. He sent and picked me up from school everyday for years. I feel sad.
